section.title: Pre-Install Requirements and Prerequisites
section.para: Ensure that the following requirements have been met before proceeding with installation.

listitem.para: Once unzipped, the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; binary release requires at least 300MB of free disk space. Keep in mind that disk space requirements may change as new releases become available.

The &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; platform will run on the same hardware as the &JEE.PLATFORM;, either on a 32Bits or 64Bits Operating System. It is recommended that your server has at least 2GB or RAM where 4GB is preferred.

A working installation of the Java Development Kit (JDK) version 5 or higher is required in order to run the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;. Note that &JEE.PLATFORM; is runtime dependency, but comes bundled with the binary distribution.
For instructions on how to install the JDK, refer to .
In order to run &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;, an external database must be installed.

warning.title: Use of Embedded H2 database
warning.para: &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; is distributed with a Java embedded database called "H2". This database is intended to be used when running &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; in a test environment. In a production setting, you will need to install an external database.

listitem.para: Postgres versions 8.2.4 and higher are supported.
Oracle versions 10g and 11g are supported.
After installing the database, make note of the JDBC URL, username and password for the database. These will be required during the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Server installation.

section.title: Installing &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Server and Agent
section.para: &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; is based on the multi-vendor RHQ management project. For the &THIS.PLATFORM; Plugin to work correctly, version 1.4.x of RHQ is required.
Since there is no released version of &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; based on RHQ 1.4.x yet, RHQ itself will be used instead.

listitem.para: Download RHQ Server from SourceForge. This is the platform server that will be responsible for storing, processing and presenting the data received by the agent(s).
Unzip the distribution in an appropriate directory on your system (i.e. in a directory not too deeply nested and with no spaces or non-ASCII characters in its name)

para.emphasis: This step is optional, if you're using Embedded H2 Database, you can skip to next

listitem.para: Install a database like PostgreSQL (version 8.2.4 +, please choose C locale for initdb), create a database instance called 'rhq' and a user 'rhqadmin' that owns this 'rhq' database.
listitem.screen: create user rhqadmin password 'rhqadmin'; create database rhq owner rhqadmin;

listitem.para: Eventually set RHQ_SERVER_JAVA_HOME or RHQ_SERVER_JAVA_EXE_FILE_PATH env variables appropriately. This is needed if your JAVA_HOME does not point to a java installation that is valid with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; (e.g. JAVA 1.4); &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; requires JAVA 5+.
In a terminal console, cd into the installation directory and start the Server:
Once, the startup messages on the console stop scrolling, point your browser to http://localhost:7080/ and run the installer:
Click on Click here to continue the installation
Choose your desired and installed database from the Database Type drop down list. If you don't want to install/use an external Database, choose H2 (embedded).
Default settings should be fine to install the server correctly. To test the DB connection, click Test Connection button.

warning.para: If the Test Connection button was used, make sure the Database Password field has not been cleared by the browser. This has been observed in certain web browsers. The default password is rhqadmin.

listitem.para: Review the selected settings, click Install Server! and wait for the process to complete.
Click on Done! Click here to get started! when the progress bar stops.
You can now Log in (default user/password are: rhqadmin/rhqadmin)and proceed to download and install the Agent.

The Agent is the component where our plugin will run. It is responsible for communicating with the managed resource (in this case, the JAIN SLEE Server) to obtain vital data like the availability metrics, operations execution, etc. The data collected will be processed and displayed by the Server.
To download the Agent, follow these steps:
Click on AdministrationDownload.
Click on Download Agent Installer and save it to where you wish to have it installed(on a local directory on the server).
In a second terminal console, cd into the directory containing the downloaded jar and install it:
The optional parameter, new agent dir indicates where the files will be installed, and defaults to the path where the jar is located.
cd into the newly created rhq-agent directory and start the Agent by issuing:
Answer the questions asked by the Agent, if any. Default setting should be sufficient.
There should be a console with a '> ' prompt. This command prompt is responsible for executing all the tasks related to the agent. The command prompt must not be closed.

section.title: Installing the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Plugin
section.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Plugin is the interface between &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; and &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE. It is responsible for gathering data from SLEE and transforming it to &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; format. It is an agent plugin, since it runs on the agent side.
&THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Plugin, may be installed in two ways:

listitem.para: In the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; GUI, in the top menu, head to AdministrationSystem ConfigurationPlugins:

On the Agent Plugins tab (selected by default), at the bottom of the page, click Add..., browse to the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; plugin JAR file and select it. It will be listed for upload as can be seen in the following snapshot:
Finally, click the Upload button and the plugin will be deployed. Click Scan for Updates to display the "Mobicents JSLEE Server 2.x".
If the agent is not running, start it and it will automatically download the new plugin. If it was already running, you should run the following command in the console to download/update the plugin:
The plugin can be deployed simply by copying it to the correct folder as shown in the steps below:
Stop the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; server and agent if they are running.
Copy the mobicents-slee-jopr-as-5-plugin-<version>.jar to the jopr-server/jbossas/server/default/deploy/rhq.ear/rhq-downloads/rhq-plugins/ directory, and it will be automatically deployed.
Start the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; server.
Start the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; agent.
